TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit XpsDocumentWriter extends System.Windows.Documents.Serialization.SerializerWriter

Docs.summary: Provides methods to write to an [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_xps](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)] document or print queue.

remarks.format:
## Remarks XpsDocumentWriter has no constructor. To create an XpsDocumentWriter, use the static <xref:System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.XpsDocument.CreateXpsDocumentWriter%2A> method of the <xref:System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.XpsDocument> class or use one of the static <xref:System.Printing.PrintQueue.CreateXpsDocumentWriter%2A> methods of the <xref:System.Printing.PrintQueue> class. The document or the queue that creates the XpsDocumentWriter becomes the target to which it writes.
## Examples The following example shows how to create an instance of the XpsDocumentWriter class.
[!code-cs[XpsSave#CreateXpsDocumentWriter](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/XpsSave/XpsSaveHelper.cs#createxpsdocumentwriter)] [!code-vb[XpsSave#CreateXpsDocumentWriter](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/xpssave/xpssavehelper.vb#createxpsdocumentwriter)]

MemberSignature.Value: public override void CancelAsync ();
.method public hidebysig virtual instance void CancelAsync() cil managed

Docs.summary: Cancels the current <xref:System.Windows.Xps.XpsDocumentWriter.WriteAsync%2A> operation.
Docs.exception: No asynchronous write operation is in progress.

MemberSignature.Value: public override System.Windows.Documents.Serialization.SerializerWriterCollator CreateVisualsCollator ();
.method public hidebysig virtual instance class System.Windows.Documents.Serialization.SerializerWriterCollator CreateVisualsCollator() cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns a that can write objects to a document or print queue.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Windows.Xps.VisualsToXpsDocument> writes to the same target <xref:System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.XpsDocument> or <xref:System.Printing.PrintQueue> as the <xref:System.Windows.Xps.XpsDocumentWriter> that creates the <xref:System.Windows.Xps.VisualsToXpsDocument>.
## Examples The following example shows how to use the CreateVisualsCollator method.
[!code-cs[XpsSave#CreateAndWriteToVisualsCollator](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/XpsSave/XpsSaveHelper.cs#createandwritetovisualscollator)] [!code-vb[XpsSave#CreateAndWriteToVisualsCollator](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/xpssave/xpssavehelper.vb#createandwritetovisualscollator)]

MemberSignature.Value: public override System.Windows.Documents.Serialization.SerializerWriterCollator CreateVisualsCollator (System.Printing.PrintTicket documentSequencePrintTicket, System.Printing.PrintTicket documentPrintTicket);

.method public hidebysig virtual instance class System.Windows.Documents.Serialization.SerializerWriterCollator CreateVisualsCollator(class System.Printing.PrintTicket documentSequencePrintTicket, class System.Printing.PrintTicket documentPrintTicket) cil managed

Docs.param: A that specifies the default printing preferences for the document sequence.
A that represents the default printing preferences for each document.
Docs.summary: Returns a that can write objects with settings to an XPS document or print queue.
Docs.returns: The new that writes elements with settings to the .

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Windows.Xps.VisualsToXpsDocument> writes to the same target <xref:System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.XpsDocument> or <xref:System.Printing.PrintQueue> as the <xref:System.Windows.Xps.XpsDocumentWriter> that creates the <xref:System.Windows.Xps.VisualsToXpsDocument>.
This method does not validate or modify the specified `documentPrintTicket` for a particular <xref:System.Printing.PrintQueue>. If necessary, use the <xref:System.Printing.PrintQueue.MergeAndValidatePrintTicket%2A> method to create a <xref:System.Printing.PrintTicket> that is specific to the <xref:System.Printing.PrintQueue> and valid for a specified printer.

MemberSignature.Value: public void Write (string documentPath);
.method public hidebysig instance void Write(string documentPath) cil managed

Docs.param: The path of the source document.
Docs.summary: Writes synchronously a specified [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_xps](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)] document to the target or .

remarks.format:
## Remarks Although the <xref:System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.XpsDocument> class has a singular name, an <xref:System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.XpsDocument> can be one <xref:System.Windows.Documents.FixedDocument> or a set of multiple documents. This method adds the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.FixedDocument> elements in the source to the set of <xref:System.Windows.Documents.FixedDocument> elements in the target <xref:System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.XpsDocument> or <xref:System.Printing.PrintQueue>.
This Write method will reserialize the specified [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_xps](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)] document which will remove all content from the <xref:System.IO.Packaging.Package> that is not required to be preserved by the [XML Paper Specification](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=65761). The reserialization will also remove all extensions from the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.FixedPage> markup, including any extended [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_xps](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)] content.
By design this Write method does not call the <xref:System.Windows.Xps.XpsDocumentWriter.WritingPrintTicketRequired> event.

MemberSignature.Value: public override void Write (System.Windows.Documents.DocumentPaginator documentPaginator);
.method public hidebysig virtual instance void Write(class System.Windows.Documents.DocumentPaginator documentPaginator) cil managed

Docs.param: An object that contains a pointer to unpaginated source material and also contains methods for paginating the material.
Docs.summary: Writes synchronously paginated content from a specified to the target or .

remarks.format:
## Examples The following example shows how to use the Write method to write to an [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_xps](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)] document.
[!code-cs[XpsSave#WriteToXpsWithDocumentPaginator](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/XpsSave/XpsSaveHelper.cs#writetoxpswithdocumentpaginator)] [!code-vb[XpsSave#WriteToXpsWithDocumentPaginator](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/xpssave/xpssavehelper.vb#writetoxpswithdocumentpaginator)]

Docs.summary: Writes synchronously a specified to the target or .

remarks.format:
## Remarks Although the <xref:System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.XpsDocument> class has a singular name, an <xref:System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.XpsDocument> can be one <xref:System.Windows.Documents.FixedDocument> or a set of multiple documents. This method adds a <xref:System.Windows.Documents.FixedDocument> to the set.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Although the <xref:System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.XpsDocument> class has a singular name, an <xref:System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.XpsDocument> can be one <xref:System.Windows.Documents.FixedDocument> or a set of multiple documents. This method adds a <xref:System.Windows.Documents.FixedDocument> or a set of <xref:System.Windows.Documents.FixedDocument> elements to the existing set.

MemberSignature.Value: public void Write (string documentPath, System.Windows.Xps.XpsDocumentNotificationLevel notificationLevel);
.method public hidebysig instance void Write(string documentPath, valuetype System.Windows.Xps.XpsDocumentNotificationLevel notificationLevel) cil managed

Docs.param: The path of the source document.
An indication of whether notification is enabled.
Docs.summary: Writes synchronously a specified [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_xps](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)] document to the target or .

remarks.format:
## Remarks When `notificationLevel` is disabled, the <xref:System.Windows.Xps.XpsDocumentWriter> copies the serialized[!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_xps](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)] document to the target <xref:System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.XpsDocument> or <xref:System.Printing.PrintQueue> that created the <xref:System.Windows.Xps.XpsDocumentWriter>. When `notificationLevel` is enabled, the <xref:System.Windows.Xps.XpsDocumentWriter> first deserializes the document, next reserializes it, and then writes it to the target with progress notifications as each page is output.
Although the <xref:System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.XpsDocument> class has a singular name, an <xref:System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.XpsDocument> can be one <xref:System.Windows.Documents.FixedDocument> or a set of multiple documents. This method adds the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.FixedDocument> elements in the source to the sequence of <xref:System.Windows.Documents.FixedDocument> elements in the target <xref:System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.XpsDocument> or <xref:System.Printing.PrintQueue>.
If `notificationLevel` is specified as <xref:System.Windows.Xps.XpsDocumentNotificationLevel>, notifications are produced only when the document is serialized, not printed. To receive notifications the document must be reserialized. When a document is reserialized all content from the <xref:System.IO.Packaging.Package> that is not required to be preserved by the [XML Paper Specification (XPS)](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=65761) is removed. The reserialization will also remove all extensions from the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.FixedPage> markup, including any extended [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_xps](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)] content.
If `notificationLevel` is specified as <xref:System.Windows.Xps.XpsDocumentNotificationLevel> the document will not be reserialized and any extended content will be preserved, even when printed.
By design this Write method does not call the <xref:System.Windows.Xps.XpsDocumentWriter.WritingPrintTicketRequired> event.

MemberSignature.Value: public override void Write (System.Windows.Documents.DocumentPaginator documentPaginator, System.Printing.PrintTicket printTicket);
.method public hidebysig virtual instance void Write(class System.Windows.Documents.DocumentPaginator documentPaginator, class System.Printing.PrintTicket printTicket) cil managed

Docs.param: An object that contains a pointer to unpaginated source material and also contains methods for paginating the material.
A that represents the default printing preferences for material.
Docs.summary: Writes synchronously paginated content from a specified together with a to the target or .

remarks.format: ## Remarks This method does not validate or modify the specified `printTicket` for a particular <xref:System.Printing.PrintQueue>. If necessary, use the <xref:System.Printing.PrintQueue.MergeAndValidatePrintTicket%2A> method to create a <xref:System.Printing.PrintTicket> that is specific to the <xref:System.Printing.PrintQueue> and is valid for a specified printer.

This method adds a <xref:System.Windows.Documents.FixedDocument> to the set.
This method does not validate or modify the specified `printTicket` for a particular <xref:System.Printing.PrintQueue>. If necessary, use the <xref:System.Printing.PrintQueue.MergeAndValidatePrintTicket%2A> method to create a <xref:System.Printing.PrintTicket> that is specific to the <xref:System.Printing.PrintQueue> and is valid for a specified printer.

This method adds a <xref:System.Windows.Documents.FixedDocument> or a set of <xref:System.Windows.Documents.FixedDocument> elements to the existing set.
This method does not validate or modify the specified `printTicket` for a particular <xref:System.Printing.PrintQueue>. remarks.format:
## Remarks When `notificationLevel` is disabled, the <xref:System.Windows.Xps.XpsDocumentWriter> copies the serialized [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_xps](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)] document to the target <xref:System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.XpsDocument> or <xref:System.Printing.PrintQueue> that created the <xref:System.Windows.Xps.XpsDocumentWriter>. When `notificationLevel` is enabled, the <xref:System.Windows.Xps.XpsDocumentWriter> first deserializes the document, next reserializes it, and then writes it to the target with progress notifications as each page is output.
Although the <xref:System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.XpsDocument> class has a singular name, an <xref:System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.XpsDocument> can be one <xref:System.Windows.Documents.FixedDocument> or a set of multiple documents. This method adds the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.FixedDocument> elements in the source to the sequence of <xref:System.Windows.Documents.FixedDocument> elements in the target <xref:System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.XpsDocument> or <xref:System.Printing.PrintQueue>.
If `notificationLevel` is specified as <xref:System.Windows.Xps.XpsDocumentNotificationLevel>, notifications are produced only when the document is serialized, not printed. To receive notifications the document must be reserialized. When a document is reserialized all content from the <xref:System.IO.Packaging.Package> that is not required to be preserved by the [XML Paper Specification](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=65761) is removed. The reserialization will also remove all extensions from the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.FixedPage> markup, including any extended [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_xps](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)] content.
If `notificationLevel` is specified as <xref:System.Windows.Xps.XpsDocumentNotificationLevel> the document will not be reserialized and any extended content will be preserved, even when printed.
By design this WriteAsync method does not call the <xref:System.Windows.Xps.XpsDocumentWriter.WritingPrintTicketRequired> event.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Although the <xref:System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.XpsDocument> class has a singular name, an <xref:System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.XpsDocument> can be one <xref:System.Windows.Documents.FixedDocument> or a set of multiple documents. This method adds a <xref:System.Windows.Documents.FixedDocument> to the set.

MemberSignature.Value: public override void WriteAsync (System.Windows.Documents.FixedDocument fixedDocument, System.Printing.PrintTicket printTicket);
.method public hidebysig virtual instance void WriteAsync(class System.Windows.Documents.FixedDocument fixedDocument, class System.Printing.PrintTicket printTicket) cil managed

Docs.param: The document that is written.
A that represents the default printing preferences for the document.
Docs.summary: Writes asynchronously a specified together with a to the target or .

remarks.format:
## Remarks Although the <xref:System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.XpsDocument> class has a singular name, an <xref:System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.XpsDocument> can be one <xref:System.Windows.Documents.FixedDocument> or a set of multiple documents. This method adds a <xref:System.Windows.Documents.FixedDocument> to the set.
This method does not validate or modify the specified `printTicket` for a particular <xref:System.Printing.PrintQueue>. If necessary, use the <xref:System.Printing.PrintQueue.MergeAndValidatePrintTicket%2A> method to create a <xref:System.Printing.PrintTicket> that is specific to the <xref:System.Printing.PrintQueue> and is valid for a specified printer.

## Remarks Although the <xref:System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.XpsDocument> class has a singular name, an <xref:System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.XpsDocument> can be one <xref:System.Windows.Documents.FixedDocument> or a set of multiple documents. This method adds a <xref:System.Windows.Documents.FixedDocument> to the set.
This method does not validate or modify the specified `printTicket` for a particular <xref:System.Printing.PrintQueue>. If necessary, use the <xref:System.Printing.PrintQueue.MergeAndValidatePrintTicket%2A> method to create a <xref:System.Printing.PrintTicket> that is specific to the <xref:System.Printing.PrintQueue> and is valid for a specified printer.

MemberSignature.Value: public override void WriteAsync (System.Windows.Documents.FixedDocumentSequence fixedDocumentSequence, System.Printing.PrintTicket printTicket, object userSuppliedState);

.method public hidebysig virtual instance void WriteAsync(class System.Windows.Documents.FixedDocumentSequence fixedDocumentSequence, class System.Printing.PrintTicket printTicket, object userSuppliedState) cil managed

Docs.param: The set of documents to be written.
A that represents the default printing preferences for the set of documents.
A user-specified object to identify and associate with the asynchronous operation.
Docs.summary: Writes asynchronously a specified together with a to the target or .

remarks.format:
## Remarks WriteAsync writes a set of documents asynchronously to the <xref:System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.XpsDocument> or <xref:System.Printing.PrintQueue> that created the <xref:System.Windows.Xps.XpsDocumentWriter>. The data that is written includes a <xref:System.Printing.PrintTicket> and additional information that the caller wants to pass to an event handler.
Although the <xref:System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.XpsDocument> class has a singular name, an <xref:System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.XpsDocument> can be one <xref:System.Windows.Documents.FixedDocument> or a set of multiple documents. This method adds a <xref:System.Windows.Documents.FixedDocument> or a set of <xref:System.Windows.Documents.FixedDocument> elements to the existing sequence.
This method does not validate or modify the specified `printTicket` for a particular <xref:System.Printing.PrintQueue>. If necessary, use the <xref:System.Printing.PrintQueue.MergeAndValidatePrintTicket%2A> method to create a <xref:System.Printing.PrintTicket> that is specific to the <xref:System.Printing.PrintQueue> and is valid for a specified printer.

MemberSignature.Value: public override void WriteAsync (System.Windows.Documents.FixedPage fixedPage, System.Printing.PrintTicket printTicket, object userSuppliedState);
.method public hidebysig virtual instance void WriteAsync(class System.Windows.Documents.FixedPage fixedPage, class System.Printing.PrintTicket printTicket, object userSuppliedState) cil managed

Docs.param: The page that is written.
A that represents the default printing preferences for the page.
A user-specified object to identify and associate with the asynchronous operation.
Docs.summary: Writes asynchronously a specified together with a to the target or .

remarks.format: ## Remarks This method does not validate or modify the specified `printTicket` for a particular <xref:System.Printing.PrintQueue>. remarks.format:
## Remarks For writing multiple <xref:System.Windows.Media.Visual> elements, use <xref:System.Windows.Xps.VisualsToXpsDocument>.
This method does not validate or modify the specified `printTicket` for a particular <xref:System.Printing.PrintQueue>. If necessary, use the <xref:System.Printing.PrintQueue.MergeAndValidatePrintTicket%2A> method to create a <xref:System.Printing.PrintTicket> that is specific to the <xref:System.Printing.PrintQueue> and is valid for a specified printer.

remarks.format:
## Examples The following example shows how to use the WritingCompleted event.
[!code-cs[XpsSave#WritingEvents](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/XpsSave/XpsSaveHelper.cs#writingevents)] [!code-vb[XpsSave#WritingEvents](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/xpssave/xpssavehelper.vb#writingevents)]

MemberSignature.Value: public override event System.Windows.Documents.Serialization.WritingPrintTicketRequiredEventHandler WritingPrintTicketRequired;
.event class System.Windows.Documents.Serialization.WritingPrintTicketRequiredEventHandler WritingPrintTicketRequired

Docs.summary: Occurs just before a <xref:System.Windows.Xps.XpsDocumentWriter.Write%2A> or <xref:System.Windows.Xps.XpsDocumentWriter.WriteAsync%2A> method adds a to a document or print queue.

remarks.format:
## Remarks WritingPrintTicketRequired enables an event handler to substitute a new <xref:System.Printing.PrintTicket> for the one that is passed to the write operation.
The following four <xref:System.Windows.Xps.XpsDocumentWriter.Write%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Xps.XpsDocumentWriter.WriteAsync%2A> methods do not call the WritingPrintTicketRequired event:
- <xref:System.Windows.Xps.XpsDocumentWriter.Write%2A>(~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)
- <xref:System.Windows.Xps.XpsDocumentWriter.Write%2A>(~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md XpsDocumentNotificationLevel)
- <xref:System.Windows.Xps.XpsDocumentWriter.WriteAsync%2A>(String)
- <xref:System.Windows.Xps.XpsDocumentWriter.WriteAsync%2A>(String, XpsDocumentNotificationLevel)
## Examples The following example shows how to use the WritingPrintTicketRequired event.
[!code-cs[XpsPrint#PrintMultipleFixedContentDocuments](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/XpsPrint/XpsPrintHelper.cs#printmultiplefixedcontentdocuments)] [!code-vb[XpsPrint#PrintMultipleFixedContentDocuments](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/xpsprint/xpsprinthelper.vb#printmultiplefixedcontentdocuments)]
The event handler is created in the following example.
[!code-cs[XpsPrint#MultipleFixedContentDocuments_WritingPrintTicketRequired](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/XpsPrint/XpsPrintHelper.cs#multiplefixedcontentdocuments_writingprintticketrequired)] [!code-vb[XpsPrint#MultipleFixedContentDocuments_WritingPrintTicketRequired](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/xpsprint/xpsprinthelper.vb#multiplefixedcontentdocuments_writingprintticketrequired)]
